Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: Is there any Age Limit to participate in Adventure Sports?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: To participate in any kind of Adventure Sports, you must be 15 years old or more. Some adventure sports have a minimum age limit of 18 years. There is no upper age limit but people above 70 years of age should do this at their own risk.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: Can a solo traveller do an adventure sport?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: Yes, it is totally okay to be a solo traveller. You will find many like-minded people in the journey. In fact, more than 60% of tourists are solo travellers or groups of friends.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: What are the requirements to do Adventure Tourism?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: There are no complex formalities for Adventure sports. You need to pay the fee for the sport you choose and follow the safety instructions told by the instructor.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: Should I have a Medical or Travel Insurance?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: It is recommended to have medical/travel insurance with you before you pursue any kind of adventure sport.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: How do we get equipment for various Adventure activities?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: There are various shops that sell and rent various equipment for adventure tourism. Even some e-commerce websites have also come into business with reliable services.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: Name a few famous Adventure Tourism in Uttarakhand.
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: The most popular Adventure sports in Uttarakhand are Skiing, Trekking, Rafting, Camping, Paragliding and Mountain Biking.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: What are the Safety measures available during Adventure sport sessions?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: First, Instructors familiarise the user/ participants with the safety measures. However, in the case of a mishap, instructors are trained to administer first aid and basic medication.

Adventure Tourism FAQ.question: How much amount is required for any kind of Adventure sport?
Adventure Tourism FAQ.answer: There are multiple charges that are added in your Adventure Tourism session i.e. Camping Fee, Trekking Fee, Guides & Porter charges, etc.

Destination FAQ.question: What is the best time to visit Uttarakhand?
Destination FAQ.answer: You can visit Uttarakhand any time of the year. In summer, the state's mountains and meadows come alive with wild flowers and green carpets and treks are easy. You can also enjoy rafting and hot air ballooning in summer. In June to August, enjoy the unique beauty of the Valley of Flowers. In winter, expect dreamy snowfall and cozy warm evenings and also snow adventures.  In winters during January, February & March snowfall is seen as an attraction on the various hill stations & various snow based activities.

Destination FAQ.question: How is the weather in Uttarakhand during the whole year?
Destination FAQ.answer: During March to June, the weather in Uttarakhand is pleasant. During July to September, there is heavy rain. The weather gets colder and several parts witness snowfall during the months between October and February.

Destination FAQ.question: How easy is to get cash from the ATMs & other payment facilities?
Destination FAQ.answer: The state of Uttarakhand comprises various areas – cities, hill stations, towns, villages and forests. While ATMs (instant cash facilities) are available in large numbers in cities and town, the numbers lessen in the villages. It is, therefore, advisable to withdraw a substantial amount of cash as you pass by the cities.

Destination FAQ.question: How safe is road travel in Uttarakhand?
Destination FAQ.answer: Roads in Uttarakhand are mostly hilly and are prone to various natural events like landslides, rains and snowfall. Before you take any road, stay updated about the conditions through police & local authorities.

Destination FAQ.question: What are some of the “Must Visit” destinations in Uttarakhand?
Destination FAQ.answer: Uttarakhand has something for everybody, so naming a few of the state's “Must Visit” destinations is tough. However, some noteworthy destinations would include Auli, Kedarnath, Rajaji and Corbett national parks, Chopta, Dehradun & Mussoorie.

Destination FAQ.question: How to reach Uttarakhand?
Destination FAQ.answer: Uttarakhand is well-connected by trains, flights and roads. It's capital Dehradun and other important cities like Rishikesh and Haridwar are connected to the rest of India. You can easily plan your trip to parts of Uttarakhand from these cities through cabs, buses, trains and flights.

Destination FAQ.question: How would you describe accommodation facility of Uttarakhand?
Destination FAQ.answer: Finding accommodation in Uttarakhand is easy and comes in various price ranges, therefore fitting every pocket. You can find hotels, guest houses and even homestays for staying during your tour.

Home Stay FAQ.question: What is a Homestay & How it is different from a Hotel Stay ?
Home Stay FAQ.answer: A Homestay is very similar to a hotel but with the grace of a home-like ambience. Guests stay in a family home or nearby. Homestays provide the same comfort to people like a reputed hotel. More elaborately, a Homestay is a cultural exchange between a local family and the group/family who visit as guests. Many tourists who come to Uttarakhand stay in hotels and hence, rarely get an opportunity to experience Indian Hospitality. The people of Uttarakhand welcome guests with open arms and offer the warmest experience.

Home Stay FAQ.question: How does a Homestay work?
Home Stay FAQ.answer: Guests & Host interact with one another and share knowledge about their cultures, regions and cuisines to make for a wholesome and unforgettable experience.

Home Stay FAQ.question: Who are my Hosts?
Home Stay FAQ.answer: Generally, the hosts are families who stay in the house and in some cases they could be caretakers of the place. Most homestay are small family-owned spaces.

Home Stay FAQ.question: What are the Benefits of a Homestay?
Home Stay FAQ.answer:
There are so many reasons why you should choose Homestays over hotels. Some of them include:
A unique out-of-the-box experience with a local family.
Customised Service
More Safety for a solo woman traveller.
More opportunities to explore the local area with a localite and have an immersive experience.
Local cuisine and indigenous produce that is seldom offered in hotels.

Home Stay FAQ.question: How do I make a reservation for a Homestay?
Home Stay FAQ.answer: First of all, select a Homestay from the official website of Uttarakhand tourism and fill the form. You will then get a call from the homestay owner to confirm all the details.

Places of Interest FAQ.question: Which places are best for Family, friends and peace seekers?
Places of Interest FAQ.answer: If you are visiting with family and friends, and are looking for a peaceful locale, destinations like Dehradun, Mussoorie, Nainital, Haridwar, Rishikesh, Dharchula and Pauri Garhwal are some of your best options. Rishikesh is also ideal for those seeking peace and tranquility.

Places of Interest FAQ.question: Name some places for natural lovers and photographers.
Places of Interest FAQ.answer: If you want to see wildlife, and capture those memories in your camera, a visit to one (or many) of the state's national parks and wildlife sanctuaries and reserves. Noteworthy among them would be Jim Corbett, Nanda Devi and Rajaji national parks. For nature lovers, destinations like Kausani, Mount Abbott and Almora are ideal.

Places of Interest FAQ.question: What are the adventure destinations of Uttarakhand ?
Places of Interest FAQ.answer: Those seeking adventure during their trip must visit Rishikesh, Haridwar and Mukteshwar as these are known for such adrenaline-filled activities as trekking, water sports, bunjee jumping and much more. Rishikesh is known to be the river rafting capital of India. For such icy adventures as skiing and snowboarding, a visit to Auli is a must.

Places of Interest FAQ.question: What are the best religious places in Uttarakhand ?
Places of Interest FAQ.answer: Uttarakhand is called Devbhoomi (Land of the gods). So no matter where you are in Uttarakhand, you will find a temple nearby. For an immersive spiritual experience embark on the Char Dham, Panch Kedar and Panch Badri yatras. Chamoli is known as the 'abode of gods' as there are numerous ancient and revered temples here that are associated with Hindu mythology. As one of the highest temples dedicated to Lord Shiva, Tungnath is not to be missed either.

Places of Interest FAQ.question: What are the famous Picnic Destinations in Uttarakhand ?
Places of Interest FAQ.answer: The picnic destinations of Uttarakhand are Lansdowne and Sattal. You can go to Kotdwar to reach Lansdowne. Some of the famous places in Lansdowne are vacation rental & Alpine Resort. Sattal, which comprises seven lakes (in Hindi 'sat' means seven and 'tal' means lakes), namely Naldaymanti Tal, Lakshman Tal, Sukha Tal, Bharat Tal, Ram Tal, Sita Tal and Panna Tal, is ideal for birdwatching and boating.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How do I reach Kedarnath?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: Kedarnath is one of the revered Char Dhams (four holy sites). To visit this temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, you must first reach Haridwar from where you can avail one of the many modes of transport to reach Gauri Kund, which is the starting point of the trek to Kedarnath. You can also book Yatra buses approved by GMVN for the Char Dham yatra. Helicopter services are also available for the ease of devotees.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How do I reach Badrinath?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: The abode of Lord Vishnu, Badrinath is one of the revered Char Dhams. Buses to Badrinath are available from Haridwar and Rishikesh.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How do I reach Yamunotri?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: The source of River Yamuna and the abode of Goddess Yamuna, Yamunotri is the first stop in the Char Dham yatra. To reach Yamunotri, you can avail a bus or hire a cab from either Dehradun or Haridwar to reach Janki Chatti. From there, you have to trek about 5-6 km to reach Yamunotri. You can, alternately, also avail ponies or palanquins to cover the distance.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How do I reach Gangotri?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: Gangotri is connected by well-maintained motorable roads. You can book a taxi from Haridwar to reach Gangotri.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How many days are required for Char Dham yatra?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: If you start the tour from Haridwar or Rishikesh, then you can visit all the four sites in 10 days. There are buses organised by GMVN & other private operators.

Religious Tourism FAQ.question: How to book a package for a religious tour?
Religious Tourism FAQ.answer: These packages are available on www.gmvnl.in or any offices situated in various cities.

Trave Trade FAQ.question: What are the prerequisites for registration in travel trade?
Trave Trade FAQ.answer: Before you start registration in the travel trade, you must carry a few details with you like a valid email address, mobile number & GST registration. There are multiple official details and scanned copies of documents that are required to be uploaded to the portal.

Trave Trade FAQ.question: How much time is needed to complete the registration process?
Trave Trade FAQ.answer: After you fill the registration form, the DTO office of the respective region will conduct the verification process for it. There will be a two-step verification that will happen in the process – Online verification and On-site verification

Trave Trade FAQ.question: What are the points I need to remember while filling form for travel trade?
Trave Trade FAQ.answer:
There are few points you must know while you fill the form:
Fill all the details properly so that nothing poses as a hurdle in the verification process.
Keep digital copies of all the documents related to your business like GST registration number, pictures of your location etc.
Fill the form completely and do not leave any detail unnoticed. Check the form twice before you submit.

Trekking FAQ.question: How many treks are registered under Uttarakhand Tourism & Development Board (UTDB)?
Trekking FAQ.answer: A total of 123 treks are identified by UTDB.

Trekking FAQ.question: Are there any Formalities to observe before we start trekking?
Trekking FAQ.answer: There are formalities for booking a trekking session. That apart, you only need to pay the fee for the same.

Trekking FAQ.question: Do we get trekking equipment on rent?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Yes. You can rent trekking equipment from the shops available in various destinations like Dehradun, Rishikesh & Uttarkashi. Many e-commerce sites also sell the same at reasonable prices.

Trekking FAQ.question: How can I hire a trekking guide?
Trekking FAQ.answer: At the starting point of the trek, you can find locals who offer guide & porter services.

Trekking FAQ.question: What is the best time for Trekking?
Trekking FAQ.answer: There are many months in which you can make your plan.. They include the months between May and July, m id-September & end of November.

Trekking FAQ.question: While Trekking, does Network Coverage & Internet Connectivity stay consistent?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Yes. Internet & network coverage stays with you while trekking.

Trekking FAQ.question: Is Travel Insurance Necessary?
Trekking FAQ.answer: It is recommended to have travel insurance.

Trekking FAQ.question: In case of emergency, is there an evacuation plan?
Trekking FAQ.answer: State Disaster Response is always available in case of any emergency situation.

Trekking FAQ.question: Are there any food shops on the route of trekking?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Yes. You will come across food shops in your trekking route.

Trekking FAQ.question: Can Trekking be done solo?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Solo trekkers can opt for moderate level treks. Other trek routes are recommended for groups with a trained guide.

Trekking FAQ.question: What kinds of Toilet Facilities are available in the Trekking Route?
Trekking FAQ.answer: You must carry a shovel to make a hole for the same.

Trekking FAQ.question: How much amount is taken under trekking by the Government?
Trekking FAQ.answer: There are multiple charges taken by government i.e. Camping Fee, Trekking Fee, Guides & Porter charges & Fees for permanent camps

Trekking FAQ.question: What is the maximum altitude reached by the group on each day?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Altitude must be levelled gradually up to limit, ideally 2500 m. Two days of acclimatisation period is taken after every 600 meters.

Trekking FAQ.question: What kind of obstacles are expected during a trek?
Trekking FAQ.answer: You must follow the basic safety rules. The expected obstacles in the trek would be simple walking, trails, steep slopes and small drains. It is recommended to follow all safety rules.

Trekking FAQ.question: How much fitness is needed to go on a trek?
Trekking FAQ.answer: Beginner & intermediate level trekking can be done with basic fitness. For some Trek routes, you need to meet a few fitness standards to be considered eligible to traverse the route.

Trekking FAQ.question: Which places are to be seen for a trekking or mountaineering expedition across the country?
Trekking FAQ.answer: IMF (Indian Mountaineering Foundation) or Adventure Tour Operators Association of India (ATOAI) are two places to look around.

Trekking FAQ.question: What medical facilities are available in case of any injury or wound.
Trekking FAQ.answer: Guides & recognized Tour Operators are equipped with First Aid kits in case of any minor or major wounds.
